alert.note: Alert for Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern St. Lucie and Martin Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Indiantown, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Stuart, Indiantown and Tequesta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie
